head.supplied: D Division ¶ Albany ¶ ¶ I beg leave to report for the information of the Superintendent of Police that Baron Von Mueller arrived here at 10am 20th Inst accompanied by P. C. Bovell & native Asst from ...

div.p: From Philip Furlong to William F[ri]day
Cons 129, no. 25/644, State Records Office of Western Australia, Perth.

To proof. Check this man's use of capital letters.
MS annotation by W. F[ri]day, Sub Inspector of Police, on 31 December 1877: 'Forwarded for the information of the Supt of Police.' Name should be Finlay
complete the details.
D Division
I beg leave to report for the information of the Superintendent of Police that Baron Von Mueller arrived here at 10am 20th Inst accompanied by P. C. Bovell & native Asst from Bridgetown

The Baron stated as he had a few days to spare before Arrival of the mail steamer from Gallo he would would like to go out westward to inspect the Timber & make some collection if I could assist him. After talking the matter over he found he on required a horse & native, one pack & one riding saddle & other trifling matters which I supplied him with and offered to send a Constable with him but he declined his services as Mr George Maxwell (a Botanist) accompanies him & supplies two horses, Messrs McKail & Co. one horse so that the party Consists of the Baron, Mr Maxwell, nat & 4 horses The native Assistant is well acquainted with the locality they are going to. They left at 6 am this day 21 Inst
